intro: Leiospora bellidifolia subsp. pamirica, commonly known as the Pamir bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained, rocky soils. It has a low-growing, herbaceous habit with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
